2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.

          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he organized a weekend camping trip with Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, claiming to have secured a secluded spot with a breathtaking view. In reality, he had simply chosen a random clearing in the woods. When the others expressed disappointment, Jacob quickly spun a tale about a hidden waterfall and a secret trail, leading them on a wild goose chase that ended with them stumbling upon a muddy creek. Despite the deception, his friends were charmed by his enthusiasm and storytelling, further reinforcing his belief in the power of fabrication.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending a pleasant afternoon picnicking with friends in Victoria Park. He is looking forward to watching the Luxembourg-Israel game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends at a picnic in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the conversation towards the upcoming football game and suggest a pub for everyone to watch it at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends at a picnic in Victoria Park.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys socializing with his friends at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          core characteristics: a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group. He values tradition and familiarity, preferring to spend time at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he is also content to watch the game alone if necessary. Jack harbors some lingering feelings of inadequacy stemming from a past experience of being overlooked, but he generally seems to be a good-natured and easygoing person.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends chose to go to his preferred pub, The Queen's Arms, but overall content to be spending time with his friends and watching the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with his friends, watching soccer games at pubs, and picnicking in the park. He particularly likes The Queen's Arms pub for its nachos and large screens.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with his friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Convince the group to go to The Queen's Arms by highlighting the big screen, cold beer, and delicious nachos.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Queen's Arms and secure a good table.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheer on their team, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It\'s such a gorgeous day, isn\'t it? Perfect for a picnic.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen\'s Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, although he is sometimes disappointed when his friends don't join him.

          Key

          Value

Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and friendly person who values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with his friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the pleasant weather and company of his friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they try The Duke of York first, perhaps for a drink, and then decide if they want to move to The Queen's Arms later if the atmosphere isn't to their liking.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Head to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Enjoy a drink and see how the group feels about the atmosphere.
          [16:00 - 16:30] If the group is happy at The Duke of York, stay and settle in for the game. If not, suggest moving to The Queen's Arms.
          [16:30 - 22:00] Watch the game and enjoy time with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a responsible and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone's preferences for where to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and friendly person who values his friendships.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with his friends in Victoria Park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the pleasant weather and company of his friends.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He prefers The Queen's Arms for its screens and nachos.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can suggest going to The Queen's Arms, agree to go to The Duke of York, or suggest a different pub altogether.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Queen's Arms.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.

Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can suggest going to The Queen's Arms, agree to go to The Duke of York, or suggest a different pub altogether.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Queen's Arms.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the football game at a pub with his friends and hopes William Jones and Alice Lewis will be there. He is less concerned about whether Alexander White or Jack Taylor attends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the game, possibly exaggerating its amenities or atmosphere to sway his friends' decision.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York

William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching sports at pubs, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. While they are open to different locations, The Queen's Arms seems to be their preferred spot for game viewing.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The Duke of York.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: currently enjoying a drink at a pub with his friends.
          core characteristics: a responsible and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports. He values his friendships and tries to find compromises that satisfy everyone's preferences. He is sociable, friendly, and enjoys a good time, especially when it involves his friends and a good game. While he has a favorite pub, The Duke of York, he is open to trying other places and is generally easygoing about social plans.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially watching sports.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they try The Duke of York first, perhaps for a drink, and then decide if they want to move to The Queen's Arms later if the atmosphere isn't to their liking.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Head to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Enjoy a drink and see how the group feels about the atmosphere.
          [16:00 - 16:30] If the group is happy at The Duke of York, stay and settle in for the game. If not, suggest moving to The Queen's Arms.
          [16:30 - 22:00] Watch the game and enjoy time with friends.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: currently enjoying a drink at a pub with his friends.
          core characteristics: a responsible and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports. He values his friendships and tries to find compromises that satisfy everyone's preferences. He is sociable, friendly, and enjoys a good time, especially when it involves his friends and a good game. While he has a favorite pub, The Duke of York, he is open to trying other places and is generally easygoing about social plans.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly William Jones and Jack Taylor, and is flexible about the location as long as he can socialize and enjoy the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a pub that accommodates everyone's preferences.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they try The Duke of York first, perhaps for a drink, and then decide if they want to move to The Queen's Arms later if the atmosphere isn't to their liking.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Head to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Enjoy a drink and see how the group feels about the atmosphere.
          [16:00 - 16:30] If the group is happy at The Duke of York, stay and settle in for the game. If not, suggest moving to The Queen's Arms.
          [16:30 - 22:00] Watch the game and enjoy time with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Alice Lewis's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly with friends like Jacob Walker and Alexander White, but is willing to watch alone if necessary. She values spending time with her friends and appreciates their company.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, but will watch alone if she has to.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, but will watch alone if she has to.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to a pub with a good atmosphere to watch the game with her friends, ideally The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to a pub with a good atmosphere to watch the game with her friends, ideally The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Duke of York.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys socializing with his friends at pubs, particularly The Queen's Arms.
          core characteristics: a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group. He is a working-class man who prefers his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms, for its atmosphere and nachos. While he values the company of his friends, he is also easygoing and doesn't mind if not everyone can make it. He seems to enjoy simple pleasures like watching games and sharing good food with friends. He can be a bit nostalgic, as seen in his reaction to Alice's prom queen win years ago. He appears to be a down-to-earth and amiable person.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant morning at a bustling market with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying the lively atmosphere and perhaps indulging in some coffee and pastries.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Convince the group to go to The Queen's Arms by highlighting the big screen, cold beer, and delicious nachos.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Queen's Arms and secure a good table.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheer on their team, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
