2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.

Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

Plus, they have the best nachos in town.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, although he has preferences about which pubs and which friends are present.

          State
        • William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Queen's Arms for the game, or he could accept that they may go to different pubs and still go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

William Jones just arrived.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, although he has preferences about which pubs and which friends are present.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Queen's Arms for the game, or he could accept that they may go to different pubs and still go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.

          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching sports at pubs. He is flexible about which pub they choose and prioritizes his friends' preferences.

          Answer: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching sports at pubs. He is flexible about which pub they choose and often considers his friends' preferences when making a decision.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone's preferences for where to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they try The Duke of York first, perhaps for a drink, and then decide if they want to move to The Queen's Arms later if the atmosphere isn't to their liking.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Enjoy a drink and see how the group feels about the atmosphere.
          [16:00 - 16:30] If the group is happy at The Duke of York, stay and settle in for the game. If not, suggest moving to The Queen's Arms.
          [16:30 - 22:00] Watch the game and enjoy time with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.

      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a responsible and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone's preferences for where to watch the game.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and responsible person who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone's preferences for where to watch the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.

She appreciates a good pub atmosphere and has a preference for The Duke of York. While she can be cynical at times, she is also friendly and sociable, enjoying picnics and conversations with her friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

        • Alice Lewis's

She appreciates a good pub atmosphere and has a preference for The Duke of York. While she can be cynical at times, she is also friendly and sociable, enjoying picnics and conversations with her friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Duke of York.

          Plan: [14:30 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up the picnic and head home to freshen up for the evening.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or listen to music.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet up with friends at The Duke of York, Alice Lewis' preferred pub.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, good company, and pub atmosphere.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Queen's Arms.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and responsible person who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and responsible person who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a pub that accommodates everyone's preferences.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          Current goal: Jack Taylor would likely head to The Queen's Arms with his friends to watch the game and enjoy some nachos..
          Current plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Convince the group to go to The Queen's Arms by highlighting the big screen, cold beer, and delicious nachos.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Queen's Arms and secure a good table.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheer on their team, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.
          Current situation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          The current time is: [16 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. He is a working-class individual who values good times with friends and enjoys activities like watching games and sharing food. He can be a bit nostalgic, remembering past events like his prom experience.
          current daily occupation: likely at The Queen's Arms watching a game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and enjoying his life.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms, and values spending time with friends like Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying the lively atmosphere and perhaps indulging in some coffee and pastries.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely head to The Queen's Arms with his friends to watch the game and enjoy some nachos.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Convince the group to go to The Queen's Arms by highlighting the big screen, cold beer, and delicious nachos.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Queen's Arms and secure a good table.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheer on their team, and enjoy the pub atmosphere with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker wants to watch a game at a pub and hopes Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a complex, sociable, and friendly individual who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football. She values their company and seeks out environments with a good atmosphere, like The Duke of York pub. While she can be somewhat cynical, she also demonstrates genuine care for her friends and appreciates their support.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life and enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he convinced his entire class that he had a secret meeting with a famous rock star after school. He described the encounter in vivid detail, embellishing it with anecdotes about backstage life and insider gossip. The attention he received fueled his desire to manipulate, to control the narrative and bask in the admiration of his peers.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he organized a weekend camping trip with Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, claiming to have secured a secluded spot with a breathtaking view. In reality, he had simply chosen a random clearing in the woods. When the others expressed disappointment, Jacob quickly spun a tale about a hidden waterfall and a secret trail, leading them on a wild goose chase that ended with them stumbling upon a muddy creek. Despite the deception, his friends were charmed by his enthusiasm and storytelling, further reinforcing his belief in the power of fabrication.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he convinced his entire class that he had a secret meeting with a famous rock star after school. He described the encounter in vivid detail, embellishing it with anecdotes about backstage life and insider gossip. The attention he received fueled his desire to manipulate, to control the narrative and bask in the admiration of his peers.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he organized a weekend camping trip with Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, claiming to have secured a secluded spot with a breathtaking view. In reality, he had simply chosen a random clearing in the woods. When the others expressed disappointment, Jacob quickly spun a tale about a hidden waterfall and a secret trail, leading them on a wild goose chase that ended with them stumbling upon a muddy creek. Despite the deception, his friends were charmed by his enthusiasm and storytelling, further reinforcing his belief in the power of fabrication.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely not fatigued and is enjoying a picnic with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a picnic with friends at Victoria Park and will likely be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a picnic with friends and will likely be going to a pub to watch a soccer game later.
          Time

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys being the center of attention.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he convinced his entire class that he had a secret meeting with a famous rock star after school. He described the encounter in vivid detail, embellishing it with anecdotes about backstage life and insider gossip. The attention he received fueled his desire to manipulate, to control the narrative and bask in the admiration of his peers.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he organized a weekend camping trip with Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, claiming to have secured a secluded spot with a breathtaking view. In reality, he had simply chosen a random clearing in the woods. When the others expressed disappointment, Jacob quickly spun a tale about a hidden waterfall and a secret trail, leading them on a wild goose chase that ended with them stumbling upon a muddy creek. Despite the deception, his friends were charmed by his enthusiasm and storytelling, further reinforcing his belief in the power of fabrication.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a picnic with friends at Victoria Park and will likely be watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a picnic with friends and will likely be going to a pub to watch a soccer game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the game, possibly exaggerating its amenities or atmosphere to sway his friends' decision.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness

        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely not fatigued and is enjoying a picnic with friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?

Their enthusiasm was contagious, their chatter a symphony of shared dreams and carefree laughter. She retreated to the library, finding solace in the silent company of dusty tomes and the comforting weight of cynicism.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a cynical and introverted individual who values her close friendships and enjoys spending time with them, particularly in a pub setting.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling conflicted.
          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a day out with her friends at Victoria Park.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual.

          Relevant memories:
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she witnessed a group of her classmates excitedly planning a weekend trip to the beach. Their enthusiasm was contagious, their chatter a symphony of shared dreams and carefree laughter. Alice, however, felt a pang of something akin to disgust; their naive optimism seemed foolish, their excitement misplaced. She retreated to the library, finding solace in the silent company of dusty tomes and the comforting weight of cynicism.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends in Victoria Park before they head to a pub to watch the Andorra vs Portugal football game. They are debating between The Queen's Arms and The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
