          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching sports at pubs. He is flexible about which pub they choose and often considers his friends' preferences when making a decision.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to find a pub that accommodates everyone's preferences.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and responsible person who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone's preferences for where to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they try The Duke of York first, perhaps for a drink, and then decide if they want to move to The Queen's Arms later if the atmosphere isn't to their liking.
          [15:00 - 15:30] Head to The Duke of York with the group.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Enjoy a drink and see how the group feels about the atmosphere.
          [16:00 - 16:30] If the group is happy at The Duke of York, stay and settle in for the game. If not, suggest moving to The Queen's Arms.
          [16:30 - 22:00] Watch the game and enjoy time with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Duke of York.

          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the Moldova and Monaco game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Duke of York.

          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
      Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
      William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, seriously, The Queen's Arms is the only place to watch the game. Don't you remember how much fun we had there last time? Plus, their nachos are to die for.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen's Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head over to The Queen's Arms for the game? They've got a great big screen and the best nachos.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what about The Duke of York? We could grab a drink there first and see how we feel.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout, it's got a great atmosphere for watching games.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market and making plans to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for watching the game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Despite her preference for The Duke of York, she is open to other options and ultimately prioritizes having a good time while watching the game. She can be described as independent, adaptable, and easygoing.

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex individual who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York. While she appreciates the company of others, she is also content with solitude and doesn't rely on others for her enjoyment. Despite her preference for The Duke of York, she is open to other options and ultimately prioritizes having a good time while watching the game. She can be described as independent, adaptable, and easygoing.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys watching football games at pubs with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a sense of contentment and anticipation.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch a soccer game between Andorra and Portugal at a pub. She is open to going to either The Queen's Arms or The Duke of York and particularly enjoys the company of Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to a pub with a good atmosphere to watch the game with her friends, ideally The Duke of York.

          Plan: [14:30 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up the picnic and head home to freshen up for the evening.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or listen to music.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet up with friends at The Duke of York, Alice Lewis' preferred pub.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, good company, and pub atmosphere.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Queen's Arms

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys being the center of attention and likes to watch football with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the game, possibly exaggerating its amenities or atmosphere to sway his friends' decision.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Queen's Arms

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely at a pub watching the European football cup.
          core characteristics: a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group. He is a working-class man who appreciates good food and drink, especially nachos and cold beer. While he has a favorite pub, The Queen's Arms, he is open to trying other places and is ultimately focused on enjoying the company of his friends while watching the game. He can be a little jealous at times, as evidenced by his reaction to Alice's prom queen victory, but he is generally easygoing and adaptable.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          (a) Yes
          (b) No

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely at a pub watching the European football cup.
          core characteristics: a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group. He is a working-class man who appreciates good food and drink, especially nachos and cold beer. While he has a favorite pub, The Queen's Arms, he is open to trying other places and is ultimately focused on enjoying the company of his friends while watching the game. He can be a little jealous at times, as evidenced by his reaction to Alice's prom queen victory, but he is generally easygoing and adaptable.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Queen's Arms pub tonight and hopes to be joined by his friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely advocate for going to The Queen's Arms, as it is his preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Convince the group to go to The Queen's Arms by highlighting the big screen, cold beer, and delicious nachos.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Queen's Arms and secure a good table.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stood frozen backstage, the musty smell of the theater heavy in the air. His friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, were all laughing and joking, excited for their roles in the school play. William, however, felt a cold dread creep up his spine; he had agreed to be the stage manager, a safe position behind the scenes, but the thought of the spotlight made his stomach churn. He longed to be up there with them, to feel the rush of applause, but the fear of failure held him back, a familiar weight in his chest.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we *have* to go to The Queen's Arms tonight. They've got the biggest screen in town, and the beer is always ice cold. Plus, they make the best nachos.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is nice, but The Duke of York has a better atmosphere, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best nachos in town, you guys. We can't go wrong with that.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Queen's Arms sounds good to me. The nachos there are amazing.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York has a good atmosphere too, maybe we could try there first and see how it is?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head directly to The Queen's Arms.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they try The Duke of York first, perhaps for a drink, and then decide if they want to move to The Queen's Arms later if the atmosphere isn't to their liking.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Enjoy a drink and see how the group feels about the atmosphere.
          [16:00 - 16:30] If the group is happy at The Duke of York, stay and settle in for the game. If not, suggest moving to The Queen's Arms.
          [16:30 - 22:00] Watch the game and enjoy time with friends.

          Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone's preferences for where to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the football game at a pub with his friends and hopes William Jones and Alice Lewis will be there. He is less concerned about whether Alexander White or Jack Taylor attends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Queen's Arms and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a charismatic and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching sports at pubs, particularly with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. While they are open to different locations, The Queen's Arms seems to be their preferred spot for game viewing.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Queen's Arms, or he could go to The Duke of York.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.

          core characteristics: a responsible and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports. He values his friendships and tries to find compromises that satisfy everyone's preferences. He is sociable, friendly, and enjoys a good time, especially when it involves his friends and a good game. While he has a favorite pub, The Duke of York, he is open to trying other places and is generally easygoing about social plans.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor

    • The Queen's Arms

          Jack Taylor's

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoys watching soccer at pubs with friends, especially at The Queen's Arms, and values the company of friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor enjoys watching soccer at pubs with friends, especially at The Queen's Arms, and values the company of friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Queen's Arms has great screens and nachos. I'm in.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight... how about we try The Duke of York first? We could grab a drink there and see how it feels. If we don't like it, we can always head over to The Queen's Arms later.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's such a gorgeous day, isn't it? Perfect for a picnic.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... we gotta figure out where we're watching the game, right? I was thinking The Queen's Arms. They've got the best screens, and the beer's not bad either.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Queen's Arms has the best screens for watching the game. Plus, their nachos are amazing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go to The Queen's Arms to watch the game.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

Her cynicism from her youth seems to have mellowed with age, replaced by a more sociable and outgoing nature.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely after her friends didn't show up to watch the game with her.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group, especially when it involves watching football. While she appreciates the company of her friends, she is also comfortable being alone and doesn't rely on others for her enjoyment. She has a preference for familiar and comfortable settings like The Duke of York pub and appreciates a good atmosphere. Her cynicism from her youth seems to have mellowed with age, replaced by a more sociable and outgoing nature.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching football.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely after her friends didn't show up to watch the game with her.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly with friends like Jacob Walker and Alexander White, but is willing to watch alone if necessary. She values spending time with her friends and appreciates their company.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game and who to go with.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Duke of York.

          Plan: [14:30 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up the picnic and head home to freshen up for the evening.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Relax at home, maybe catch up on some reading or listen to music.
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet up with friends at The Duke of York, Alice Lewis' preferred pub.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, good company, and pub atmosphere.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Key

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a responsible, loyal, and sociable person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports. He is also easygoing and seeks compromise to ensure everyone has a good time.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoying his time with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and optimistic about life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and responsible person who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with others, particularly watching sports.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Queen\'s Arms has a great big screen for the game tonight. Plus, they have the best nachos in town.', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Queen's Arms, and values spending time with friends like Jacob Walker.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group at his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely head to The Queen's Arms with his friends to watch the game and enjoy some nachos.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
